intro: Prestoniopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy prestoniopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. Prestoniopsis hirsuta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
